0.speaker: speaker1
0.text: Say , Jim , how about going for a few beers after dinner ?

0.speaker: speaker2
0.text: You know that is tempting but is really not good for our fitness .

0.speaker: speaker1
0.text: What do you mean ? It will help us to relax .

0.speaker: speaker2
0.text: Do you really think so ? I don't . It will just make us fat and act silly . Remember last time ?

0.speaker: speaker1
0.text: I guess you are right.But what shall we do ? I don't feel like sitting at home .

0.speaker: speaker2
0.text: I suggest a walk over to the gym where we can play singsong and meet some of our friends .

0.speaker: speaker1
0.text: That's a good idea . I hear Mary and Sally often go there to play pingpong.Perhaps we can make a foursome with them .

0.speaker: speaker2
0.text: Sounds great to me ! If they are willing , we could ask them to go dancing with us.That is excellent exercise and fun , too .

1.speaker: speaker2
1.text: Of course I can . It's a piece of cake ! Believe it or not , I can do 30 push-ups a minute .

1.speaker: speaker2
1.text: It's easy . If you do exercise everyday , you can make it , too .

2.speaker: speaker1
2.text: Can you study with the radio on ?

2.speaker: speaker2
2.text: No , I listen to background music .

2.speaker: speaker2
2.text: The radio has too many comerials .

2.speaker: speaker1
2.text: That's true , but then you have to buy a record player .

3.speaker: speaker2
3.text: I will be all right soon . I was terrified when I watched them fall from the wire .

4.speaker: speaker1
4.text: Hey John , nice skates . Are they new ?

4.speaker: speaker2
4.text: Yeah , I just got them . I started playing ice hockey in a community league . So , I finally got myself new skates .

4.speaker: speaker2
4.text: I ’ m a defender . It ’ s a lot of fun . You don ’ t have to be able to skate as fast on defense .

4.speaker: speaker1
4.text: Yeah , you ’ re a pretty big guy . I play goalie , myself .

4.speaker: speaker2
4.text: Really ? I think we play you guys next week . Well , I have to go to practice . See you later .

5.speaker: speaker1
5.text: Hey Lydia , what are you reading ?

5.speaker: speaker2
5.text: I ’ m looking at my horoscope for this month ! My outlook is very positive . It says that I should take a vacation to someplace exotic , and that I will have a passionate summer fling !

5.speaker: speaker1
5.text: What are you talking about ? Let me see that ... What are horoscopes ?

5.speaker: speaker2
5.text: It ’ s a prediction of your month , based on your zodiac sign . You have a different sign for the month and date you were born in . I was born on April 15th , so I ’ m an Aries . When were you born ?

5.speaker: speaker2
5.text: Let ’ s see . . . you ’ re a Capricorn . It says that you will be feeling stress at work , but you could see new , exciting developments in your love life . Looks like we ’ ll both have interesting summers !

5.speaker: speaker1
5.text: That ’ s bogus . I don't feel any stress at work , and my love life is practically nonexistent . This zodiac stuff is all a bunch of nonsense .

5.speaker: speaker2
5.text: No , it ’ s not , your astrology sign can tell you a lot about your personality . See ? It says that an Aries is energetic and loves to socialize .

5.speaker: speaker1
5.text: Well , you certainly match those criteria , but they ’ re so broad they could apply to anyone . What does it say about me ?

5.speaker: speaker2
5.text: A Capricorn is serious-minded and practical . She likes to do things in conventional ways . That sounds just like you !

6.speaker: speaker1
6.text: Frank ’ s getting married , do you believe this ?

6.speaker: speaker1
6.text: Yes , he is . He loves the girl very much .

6.speaker: speaker1
6.text: A girl he met on holiday in Spain , I think .

6.speaker: speaker2
6.text: Have they set a date for the wedding ?

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: I hear you bought a new house in the northern suburbs .

7.speaker: speaker2
7.text: That ’ s right , we bought it the same day we came on the market .

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: What kind of house is it ?

7.speaker: speaker2
7.text: It ’ s a wonderful Spanish style .

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: Oh , I love the roof tiles on Spanish style houses .

7.speaker: speaker2
7.text: And it ’ s a bargaining . A house like this in river side costs double the price .

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: Great , is it a two bedroom house ?

7.speaker: speaker2
7.text: No , it has three bedrooms and three beds , and has a living room with a twelve-foot ceiling . There ’ s a two-car garage .

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: That ’ s a nice area too . It ’ ll be a good investment for you .

7.speaker: speaker2
7.text: Yeas , when will you buy a house ?

7.speaker: speaker1
7.text: Not untill the end of this year , you know , just before my wedding .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: Not much , except that my mother-in-law is driving me up the wall .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: She loves to nit-pick and criticizes everything that I do . I can never do anything right when she's around .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: Well , last week I invited her over to dinner . My husband and I had no problem with the food , but if you listened to her , then it would seem like I fed her old meat and rotten vegetables . There's just nothing can please her .

8.speaker: speaker1
8.text: No , I can't see that happening . I know you're a good cook and nothing like that would ever happen .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: It's not just that . She also criticizes how we raise the kids .

8.speaker: speaker1
8.text: My mother-in-law used to do the same thing to us . If it wasn't disciplining them enough , then we were disciplining them too much . She also complained about the food we fed them , the schools we sent them too , and everything else under the sun .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: You said she used to ? How did you stop her ?

8.speaker: speaker1
8.text: We basically sat her down and told her how we felt about her constant criticizing , and how we welcomed her advice but hoped she'd let us do our things . She understood , and now everything is a lot more peaceful .

8.speaker: speaker2
8.text: That sounds like a good idea . I'll have to try that .

9.speaker: speaker1
9.text: How are Zina's new programmers working out ?

9.speaker: speaker2
9.text: I hate to admit it , but they're good . And fast . The Filipino kid is a genius .

9.speaker: speaker1
9.text: So you'll make the Stars.com deadline , and have us up and running next week ?

9.speaker: speaker2
9.text: It'll be close , but we'll make it .

9.speaker: speaker1
9.text: Good . After Stars.com starts paying us , we won't need Vikam's cash anymore .

9.speaker: speaker2
9.text: And if we don't need them , we won't need Zina , either .

10.speaker: speaker2
10.text: Yes . I like cooking very much . I got this hobby when I was 12 years sold .

10.speaker: speaker2
10.text: I have no idea . I like cooking by myself . I like to taste delicious food .

10.speaker: speaker2
10.text: And I love trying new recipes , which I usually test with my friends . You can come , too .

10.speaker: speaker1
10.text: Really ? I hope I can have a chance to taste it . Don't forget to tell me .

11.speaker: speaker2
11.text: I'm in the kitchen ... let yourself in !

11.speaker: speaker1
11.text: Wow ! You're really working up a storm !

11.speaker: speaker2
11.text: I know . I've even worked up a sweat .

11.speaker: speaker1
11.text: You look like a cooking show host--only messier .

12.speaker: speaker1
12.text: You look so tan and healthy !

12.speaker: speaker2
12.text: Thanks . I just got back from summer camp .

12.speaker: speaker2
12.text: Great . I got to try so many things for the first time .

12.speaker: speaker2
12.text: I went sailing , fishing , and horseback riding .

12.speaker: speaker2
12.text: The counselors were so nice too . It was the best summer ever . Except for all those mosquitoes !

13.speaker: speaker1
13.text: Diana , do you like the perfume I gave you ?

13.speaker: speaker2
13.text: It ’ s good . But to tell you the truth , I don ’ t wear perfume .

13.speaker: speaker1
13.text: I ’ m sorry . I didn ’ t know that .

13.speaker: speaker2
13.text: That ’ s all right . Thank you all the same .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: All right , Bill.Here ' s your daily exercise schedule . You are to jog before breakfast .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: Then , you are to walk to work .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: Thirty minutes in gym at lunch time .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: Use the stairs , never the elevator .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: And three times a week , you can either swim , play racketball , or hand ball .

14.speaker: speaker2
14.text: OK , you can stop now.It ' s time for the dance class .

14.speaker: speaker1
14.text: Dance class ! I don't know how .

15.speaker: speaker1
15.text: Hi Bill , I saw your grandma yesterday .

15.speaker: speaker1
15.text: I was running around the track at my college and there she was walking around the same track .

15.speaker: speaker2
15.text: Grannie always tries to stay fit and healthy.She is always making us kids eat the proper foods .

15.speaker: speaker1
15.text: Well , it pays off for her.How old is she anyway ?

16.speaker: speaker1
16.text: I would like to register for a class today .

16.speaker: speaker2
16.text: No problem , what class would you like to take ?

16.speaker: speaker1
16.text: I would very much enjoy taking a Psychology class.Because I'm crazy .

16.speaker: speaker2
16.text: There are two classes that are still open .

16.speaker: speaker1
16.text: Which days are these classes on ?

16.speaker: speaker2
16.text: The first class is a Tuesday and Thursday class from two to three .

16.speaker: speaker2
16.text: The other class is on Monday and Wednesday from 10 am - 12 .

16.speaker: speaker1
16.text: Are you sure there are no more open classes ?

16.speaker: speaker1
16.text: Sign me up for Monday and Wednesday .

17.speaker: speaker1
17.text: Dad , why are you taping the windows ?

17.speaker: speaker1
17.text: Really ? Wow , I don't have to go to school tomorrow .

17.speaker: speaker2
17.text: Jenny , come and help , we need to prepare more food .

18.speaker: speaker1
18.text: Hi , my name is Lean , and I'm from Russia .

18.speaker: speaker2
18.text: Nice to meet you , Lean . My name is Alike . I'm from Japan .

18.speaker: speaker1
18.text: To me English is a difficult language .

18.speaker: speaker2
18.text: A second language is always difficult .

18.speaker: speaker1
18.text: True , but English is harder than most . It's a crazy language .

18.speaker: speaker2
18.text: A crazy language ? Why do you say that ?

18.speaker: speaker1
18.text: One letter can have several pronunciations and one word can have several meanings .

18.speaker: speaker2
18.text: No wonder you say English is a crazy language .

19.speaker: speaker2
19.text: I hope so . I'm looking for some material for a paper I'm writing , and I'm not quite sure where to look .

19.speaker: speaker1
19.text: I'll certainly try to help you . What topic is your paper on ?

19.speaker: speaker2
19.text: My paper is on the influence of television on children .

19.speaker: speaker1
19.text: There are several possible sources you might use for that topic . I suggest you use the computer and the computer will give you a list of every scientific journal that talks about children and television .

20.speaker: speaker1
20.text: Here ’ s your hot dog and beer . What happened ? Did I miss anything ?

20.speaker: speaker2
20.text: Yeah , Cal Ripen just hit a home run .

20.speaker: speaker2
20.text: Well it was 3 to 4 , but Ripen ’ s home run made it 5 to 4 since another player was on first base .

20.speaker: speaker1
20.text: This is a really great place to watch a baseball game .

20.speaker: speaker2
20.text: Yeah , there isn ’ t a bad seat in the place .

20.speaker: speaker1
20.text: The fans are great here , too . Not like in Philadelphia .

20.speaker: speaker2
20.text: It was a great idea to spend a day watching a game .

20.speaker: speaker1
20.text: Yeah , it reminds you why they say baseball is America ’ s favorite pastime .

21.speaker: speaker1
21.text: How do you like the pizza here ?

21.speaker: speaker2
21.text: Perfect . It really hits the spot .

23.speaker: speaker1
23.text: I was scared stiff of giving my first performance .

23.speaker: speaker2
23.text: Were you ? your performance was excellent .

23.speaker: speaker1
23.text: Thank you for your kindly words .

24.speaker: speaker1
24.text: Excuse me . Could you please take a picture of us with this camera ?

24.speaker: speaker2
24.text: Sure . Which button do I press to shoot ?

24.speaker: speaker2
24.text: Do I have to focus it ?

24.speaker: speaker1
24.text: No , this is a focus-free camera . All you have to do is point and press the button .

25.speaker: speaker1
25.text: Every country should face the history .

25.speaker: speaker2
25.text: Yeah , we don ’ t live in the vacuum . We have traditional values and long but different history .

25.speaker: speaker1
25.text: Sometimes , we , human beings , really had done something wrong , so we should admit it at first .

25.speaker: speaker2
25.text: But there is always somebody who wants to turn his back on the true history .

25.speaker: speaker1
25.text: I believe such things won ’ t be realized , just daydreaming .

26.speaker: speaker2
26.text: I like traveling for pleasure to get places for vacation for instance . But I don ’ t like traveling to work , waiting for buses , or ...

26.speaker: speaker1
26.text: Or getting stuck in traffic jams when you ’ re driving .

27.speaker: speaker1
27.text: Your house is too small . Why not buy a big one .

27.speaker: speaker2
27.text: I do wish I could afford one .

27.speaker: speaker1
27.text: You can get a loan from the bank . You know LPF program provides low cost loans for participants home purchases .

27.speaker: speaker2
27.text: Of course I know that . But don't you notice that the house price is skyrocketing ?

28.speaker: speaker2
28.text: How do you do , Ms . Yang.You speak very good English .

28.speaker: speaker1
28.text: Thank you . I begin to like English even when I was a child .

28.speaker: speaker1
28.text: At school , in China.This is my first time to be out of my own country .

29.speaker: speaker1
29.text: Do you want black or white coffee ?

29.speaker: speaker1
29.text: Look ! there's a Folk concert tomorrow evening . Do you Want to go ?

29.speaker: speaker2
29.text: I don't like Folk music very much .

29.speaker: speaker1
29.text: What kind of music do you like ?

29.speaker: speaker2
29.text: I like classical music . Do you ?

29.speaker: speaker1
29.text: Not very much . Classical music sends me to sleep

29.speaker: speaker1
29.text: So are you ! How about another coffee ?

30.speaker: speaker1
30.text: What do you like to do in your spare time ?

30.speaker: speaker1
30.text: Do you have any hobbies besides playing chess ?

30.speaker: speaker1
30.text: Do you have any hobbies like playing tennis or things like that ?

30.speaker: speaker2
30.text: Oh , yes . I like playing basketball .

30.speaker: speaker1
30.text: Can you tell me why you like it ?

30.speaker: speaker2
30.text: Because I like the feeling of cooperating with others .

31.speaker: speaker1
31.text: Where is John ? I can't find him anywhere .

31.speaker: speaker2
31.text: Haven't you heard that he is in prison ?

31.speaker: speaker2
31.text: John is in prison now . He was copped outstealing .

31.speaker: speaker1
31.text: I just cann't believe my ears !

32.speaker: speaker2
32.text: I hope so . I'm looking for some material for a paper I'm writing , and I'm not quite sure where to look .

32.speaker: speaker1
32.text: I'll certainly try to help you.What topic is your paper on ?

32.speaker: speaker2
32.text: My paper is on the influence of television on children .

32.speaker: speaker1
32.text: There are several possible sources you might use for that topic . I suggest you use the computer and the computer will give you a list of every scientific journal that talks about children and television .

33.speaker: speaker1
33.text: Hey , Ted . What are you up to this Friday ?

33.speaker: speaker2
33.text: Well , I have the day off from work .

33.speaker: speaker1
33.text: That ’ s great ! Do you have any plans ?

33.speaker: speaker2
33.text: Well , I ’ Ve been working so hard lately , so I ’ ll probably just take it easy .

33.speaker: speaker2
33.text: Yeah , I ’ ll probably just stay in and relax . Maybe watch a few movies .

34.speaker: speaker1
34.text: You honestly believe the world ’ s improving every year ?

34.speaker: speaker2
34.text: Yes , I do . I think that science is making us wiser . What do you think ?

34.speaker: speaker1
34.text: I don ’ t think you ’ re right there .

34.speaker: speaker2
34.text: I believe industry is making us wealthier .

34.speaker: speaker2
34.text: And in my opinion , medicine is making us healthier .

34.speaker: speaker1
34.text: I agree with you in the sense . But we ’ re all more miserable than ever , aren ’ t we ?

34.speaker: speaker2
34.text: I don ’ t agree with you . I maintain that we ’ re healthier , wealthier and wiser than we were a hundred years ago .

34.speaker: speaker1
34.text: That ’ s your opinion not mine .

35.speaker: speaker1
35.text: What do you plan to do for your birthday ?

35.speaker: speaker2
35.text: I want to have a picnic with my friends , Mum .

35.speaker: speaker1
35.text: How about a party at home ? That way we can get together and celebrate it .

35.speaker: speaker2
35.text: OK , Mum . I'll invite my friends home .

36.speaker: speaker2
36.text: I would like to return this book .

36.speaker: speaker2
36.text: I also want to check out this video .

36.speaker: speaker1
36.text: Is that all you would like to check out ?

36.speaker: speaker1
36.text: Do you have your library card ?

36.speaker: speaker1
36.text: Make sure to take proper care of this video .

36.speaker: speaker2
36.text: That won ’ t be a problem .

36.speaker: speaker1
36.text: If you damage the video , you will be fined .

37.speaker: speaker1
37.text: What's the matter with you then ? You look miserable .

37.speaker: speaker1
37.text: What do you mean by us .

37.speaker: speaker2
37.text: Well , you always say you're busy .

37.speaker: speaker2
37.text: And you often go back to live with your parents and leave our son in the room by himself .

37.speaker: speaker1
37.text: I ... I ... I miss my parents , also they miss me .

37.speaker: speaker2
37.text: Oh I remember , I cut terrible calls , and you didn't say anything about it .

37.speaker: speaker1
37.text: You mean I am groaned a few words ?

37.speaker: speaker2
37.text: Totally not . Perhaps it's about our marriage .

38.speaker: speaker1
38.text: Hi , Mary . You look pale today . What's the matter with you ?

38.speaker: speaker2
38.text: I think I've caught a cold . Now I'm aching all over .

38.speaker: speaker1
38.text: You'd better take some medicine and have a good rest . I hope you'll be yourself pretty soon .

38.speaker: speaker2
38.text: Thank you . I suppose I should go to see a doctor .

39.speaker: speaker1
39.text: I feel like going for a drink , it's been a long day .

39.speaker: speaker2
39.text: Great idea ! Peter , I could use the drink .

39.speaker: speaker1
39.text: How about the new bar across road ?

39.speaker: speaker2
39.text: Sounds good . The food there is fantastic , too .

39.speaker: speaker1
39.text: I agree , I had lunch there last week .

39.speaker: speaker2
39.text: excellent ! That sounds like a plan .

40.speaker: speaker1
40.text: Could you tell me the right time , please ?

40.speaker: speaker2
40.text: Well . My watch says five past two . But it ’ s no use rely on it because it has been gaining and losing these last a few days .

40.speaker: speaker1
40.text: You have to go and fix it .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: does your family have a record of your ancestors ?

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: sure . My mom has been working on our family tree for years . She ’ s always updating it .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: do you have a copy of your family tree in your house ? I ’ d love to see it .

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: I can show it to you now , if you like . I think it goes back about 8 generations so far .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: that ’ s amazing . Do you have a large extended family ?

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: I ’ Ve got 30 cousins on my mom ’ s side and 10 cousins on my dad ’ s side .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: are you very close to your first-cousins ?

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: the ones that are my age are close relatives . Now that I ’ m older , I don ’ t spend as much time with them as I used to , so I don ’ t know my younger cousins as well as the older ones .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: I see . who ’ s the head of your household ?

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: it ’ s definitely my mother . And , her mother is definitely the matriarch of the bigger family .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: that ’ s interesting . What does your grandfather think of your step-mother ?

41.speaker: speaker2
41.text: at first , she was quite critical of her , but now that they ’ Ve been married for a few years , she ’ s starting to accept the fact that my father divorced my mother .

41.speaker: speaker1
41.text: that ’ s pretty much how you feel about your step-mother . Like grandmother , like grandson .

42.speaker: speaker1
42.text: Hi , Mr . Wang . Do you feel like going boating with me ?

42.speaker: speaker2
42.text: Sounds interesting , I haven't gone boating for some time now , and what time ?

42.speaker: speaker2
42.text: Sure . Where shall I meet you ?

42.speaker: speaker1
42.text: At the gate of the park .

42.speaker: speaker2
42.text: Great . I look forward to meeting you .

43.speaker: speaker1
43.text: I hear that you've been to the Saikei Ski Resort for the weekend . Did you enjoy it ?

43.speaker: speaker2
43.text: Yes , it's so exciting , though I had the most falls in our skiing team .

43.speaker: speaker1
43.text: Isn't there any coach to teach you how to ski ?

43.speaker: speaker2
43.text: Of course there is . The top-level coaches there are from the State Sports General Administration .

43.speaker: speaker2
43.text: Yes.My face even ached in the icy wind .

43.speaker: speaker2
43.text: I was skiing on and on excitedly until I realized one thing-I could not stop ! You can just imagine how terrified I was .

44.speaker: speaker2
44.text: Yeah . I have got much pressure in the company . I have tobe wrapped upon my work .

45.speaker: speaker1
45.text: Hey , Maggy , Did you hear about David ?

45.speaker: speaker2
45.text: About David ? No , I didn ’ t hear anything .

45.speaker: speaker1
45.text: You know , about David and his new boss .

45.speaker: speaker2
45.text: Sorry , I don ’ t quite follow you .

45.speaker: speaker1
45.text: Well , I heard David has been fired .

45.speaker: speaker2
45.text: Oh , that is a shame . He is really hard working .

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: how do you usually get to school ?

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: I usually ride my bike . Which form of transport do you prefer to use ?

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: I feel that I can see more when I pedal a bicycle , but when I feel lazy , I drive my car .

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: I think we should discourage people from using their private cars . They produce too much pollution !

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: I agree , but I would find it difficult to stop using my car . It's just so convenient .

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: cars might be convenient , but they're so bad for the environment .

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: no . I used to have one though . Once I started using my bicycle to get around , I found that I didn't really need it .

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: maybe if I sold my car now , I wouldn't be so tempted to use it .

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: you could try . It would save you a lot of money .

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: that's true . Every month , I spend hundreds of dollars on gas , insurance , and repairs .

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: if you got to class by riding a bicycle every day instead of driving , you will get lots of exercise , too !

46.speaker: speaker1
46.text: I could stand to lose a few pounds . Having a car has made me lazy . I never end up walking anywhere !

46.speaker: speaker2
46.text: let's go to a car dealership . I'll help you try to sell your car for a good price .

47.speaker: speaker2
47.text: His nose is out of joint because we forgot to invite him to the party .

48.speaker: speaker1
48.text: What are you going to do for one year abroad , Tom ?

48.speaker: speaker2
48.text: Study , study , study . I want to learn a lot .

48.speaker: speaker1
48.text: You are going to take courses ?

48.speaker: speaker2
48.text: Yes . I am going to take some university courses there .

48.speaker: speaker2
48.text: Yes , but I think it's probably for the best .

48.speaker: speaker2
48.text: Hey , I am a pretty cool guy . I will make friends , and I'll have a lot of extracurricular activities too . You know , like fencing , or theater or something .

49.speaker: speaker1
49.text: Isn't this lovely weather ? Will you help me water the flowers , Jack ?

49.speaker: speaker2
49.text: Well , do you think I have to ?

49.speaker: speaker1
49.text: I do.We haven't watered them for quite a few days .

49.speaker: speaker2
49.text: Please look at the sky.Don ' t you see the dark clouds ? It's going to rain soon .

49.speaker: speaker1
49.text: Good.So we don't have to work.How nice !

49.speaker: speaker2
49.text: But I don't think it's so nice .

49.speaker: speaker2
49.text: The weather report says it's going to rain for a whole week .

49.speaker: speaker1
49.text: Oh , I'm afraid all the flowers will die in the rain .

50.speaker: speaker1
50.text: On , darn . The grocery store is closed .

50.speaker: speaker2
50.text: Yeah , this one closes at ten . We could drive to the 24 - hour store on sixth .

50.speaker: speaker1
50.text: Alright . We are out of everything .

50.speaker: speaker2
50.text: I wish the store close to us was open 24 - house a day .

50.speaker: speaker1
50.text: I know , our schedules are so weird . Sometimes , the little corner store is the only thing within walking distance that ’ s open when we get home .

50.speaker: speaker2
50.text: Yeah , and the prices there are very high .

50.speaker: speaker1
50.text: I know . Three dollars for milk .

51.speaker: speaker1
51.text: Do you think they two will get married ?

51.speaker: speaker1
51.text: I think so.Yes , they get along so well .

51.speaker: speaker2
51.text: I like him.He ' s good for her .

52.speaker: speaker1
52.text: Dad , where are we off to ?

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: First we will go to the city centre and stop for something to drink . Then we will visit the University Museum .

52.speaker: speaker1
52.text: Where are we going to have a drink ?

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: There is a coffee shop round the corner . Can you see that big building at the end of the road ?

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: That is a bank . The coffee shop is opposite the bank .

52.speaker: speaker1
52.text: Good . I will have hot chocolate .

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: A stop ! Wait for the lights to turn green .

52.speaker: speaker1
52.text: When crossing the road you must always pay attention to what's around you .

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: Sorry . How far is the museum ?

52.speaker: speaker1
52.text: I am not sure . We will ask for directions in the coffee shop .

52.speaker: speaker2
52.text: Here we are . You find us a table and I'll get the drinks .

53.speaker: speaker1
53.text: How about going to the cinema tonight ?

53.speaker: speaker1
53.text: I am not sure about the name of the film , but I know it's a romantic one .

53.speaker: speaker2
53.text: Romantic ? I am afraid I like thrillers better .

53.speaker: speaker1
53.text: Don't you think it's too bloody ?

54.speaker: speaker1
54.text: No . The teacher is dragging the chalk over the blackboard . It set my teeth on edge .

54.speaker: speaker2
54.text: He ’ ll finish writing in a minute .

55.speaker: speaker1
55.text: I have made up my mind . I am getting a tattoo .

55.speaker: speaker1
55.text: Yeah ! Why not ? They are trendy and look great ! I want to get a dragon on my arm or maybe a tiger on my back .

55.speaker: speaker2
55.text: Yeah but , it is something that you will have forever ! They use indelible ink that can only be removed with laser treatment . On top of all that , I have heard it hurts a lot !

55.speaker: speaker2
55.text: Of course ! They use this machine with a needle that pokes your skin and inserts the ink .

55.speaker: speaker1
55.text: Oh , I didn ’ t know that ! I thought they just paint it on your skin or something .

55.speaker: speaker2
55.text: I think you should reconsider and do some more research about tattoos . Also , find out where the nearest tattoo parlor is and make sure they used sterilized needles , and that the place is hygienic .

55.speaker: speaker1
55.text: Maybe I should just get a tongue piercing !

56.speaker: speaker1
56.text: Excuse me , what's the screen near your steering wheel for ?

56.speaker: speaker2
56.text: It's a portable TV . It's a popular thing now .

56.speaker: speaker1
56.text: Oh , that's new to me . So what's on everyday ?

56.speaker: speaker2
56.text: News about current affairs , documentaries , music , movies , noncommercial ads and so on .

56.speaker: speaker2
56.text: Yes , there are something good and informative . I think that many people underestimate the value of TV in education .

56.speaker: speaker1
56.text: I agree . Are there any commercials on the TV ?

56.speaker: speaker2
56.text: Of course . Because the TV stations need to make money from commercials between the programs .

56.speaker: speaker1
56.text: That makes a lot of sense . Does the TV work well ?

56.speaker: speaker2
56.text: Not always . It depends on the transmission of the satellite signals .

56.speaker: speaker1
56.text: I got it . Do you pay for the programs ?

57.speaker: speaker1
57.text: Look at the view from the window .

57.speaker: speaker2
57.text: Oh , dear . That ’ s terrible . Not at all what I expected .

57.speaker: speaker1
57.text: It ’ s awful , isn ’ t it ?

57.speaker: speaker2
57.text: I can ’ t bear to look at it . I ’ m rather disappointed .

58.speaker: speaker1
58.text: What do you do in your free time , Nancy ?

58.speaker: speaker2
58.text: Well , I like playing the violin .

58.speaker: speaker1
58.text: Really ? How long have you been playing the violin ?

58.speaker: speaker2
58.text: About ten years so far . I started learning when I was in middle school .

58.speaker: speaker2
58.text: Sure . So what about you ? Do you have any hobbies ?

58.speaker: speaker1
58.text: Well , I like collecting matchbox ! I'm not sure if that counts , though .

58.speaker: speaker2
58.text: Of course it does . Everybody has his own hobby .

59.speaker: speaker1
59.text: How can I tell her about this ?

59.speaker: speaker2
59.text: Don't worry , you'll find a way .

59.speaker: speaker1
59.text: There is no need to be so frustrated .

59.speaker: speaker2
59.text: How can you live without job in the future ?

59.speaker: speaker1
59.text: Don't worry , you'll find a way .

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: What sports do you like to play ?

60.speaker: speaker2
60.text: In my country football is brand new , so I never learned the game when I was younger .

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: It's a very popular game in America .

60.speaker: speaker2
60.text: Yeah . I heard a lot about it . Is it really that fun ?

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: For me , it's one of those games that are fun to both watch and play .

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: No , I just for fun with my friends . We play two hand touch or flag football . We're too old to play tackle football .

60.speaker: speaker2
60.text: What is two hand touch and flag football ?

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: Instead of tackling somebody , you just have to touch them with two hands , or if it is flag football , grab the flag that the ball carrier is wearing .

60.speaker: speaker2
60.text: I see . It's safer then right ?

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: Exactly . We play every Saturdays on the field by the tennis courts . If you want to learn and play a little , you're welcome to join us .

60.speaker: speaker2
60.text: I'll give it a try . Give me a call and let's go down together .

60.speaker: speaker1
60.text: Ok . I'll call you Saturday morning .

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: My parents called . As usual , they reminded me again that I should have a plan to marry by my late 20s . Easier said then done . Who should I marry ? I have no time to go on a date .

61.speaker: speaker1
61.text: It is not your mother finding one for you ?

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: I will find one myself , of course . I ’ m a modern girl .

61.speaker: speaker1
61.text: Perhaps you can try the three minutes date , the latest type .

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: You mean dozens of the opposite sex meet each other for three minutes in a dimly bar serving alcohol , I hate that idea .

61.speaker: speaker1
61.text: No , there is an updated virgin , three minutes video date . I know an online dating website providing such service with a microphone and webcam , you can sigh for it . You can be face-to-face with a guy talking for maximum three minutes .

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: I don ’ t think it makes sense . Three minutes is such a short time .

61.speaker: speaker1
61.text: I think you can find out if there is a possibility of romance within the first second of meeting someone , so-called love at first sight .

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: Anyway , I don ’ t want to post my face up for sale on the internet like that .

61.speaker: speaker1
61.text: Don ’ t worry . There are many other options using the internet as dating methods . Some sites operate at international standard even have got certifications . Of course , for these sites , you have to pay a membership fee . But all in all , it is more serious and professional . The chance of meeting a good and serious person who does not play games is higher .

61.speaker: speaker2
61.text: I don ’ t want to post my personal information on the internet . I ’ m not knowing who is reading it .

62.speaker: speaker1
62.text: Are you going to the party on Saturday ?

62.speaker: speaker2
62.text: I was thinking about it . Are you ?

62.speaker: speaker1
62.text: Yeah , I heard it's going to be a lot of fun .

62.speaker: speaker2
62.text: Really ? Well , what time does it start ?

62.speaker: speaker2
62.text: Well , who all is going to be there ?

62.speaker: speaker2
62.text: How do you know it's going to be so fun ?

62.speaker: speaker1
62.text: This party is going to have a DJ , food , and drinks .

62.speaker: speaker2
62.text: Wow , that does sound like it's going to be fun .

62.speaker: speaker1
62.text: So am I going to see you at the party ?

63.speaker: speaker1
63.text: Could you talk to me for a few minutes about my grades ?

63.speaker: speaker2
63.text: Step into my office for a moment . What is your concern ?

63.speaker: speaker2
63.text: Let's go on the computer to see what's up . Do you think you are doing well ?

63.speaker: speaker1
63.text: I am pretty sure that I am in trouble .

63.speaker: speaker2
63.text: I can see that you are trying , but where do you think you could improve ?

63.speaker: speaker1
63.text: I missed a few classes ; I need to make sure I come to school on a regular basis .

63.speaker: speaker2
63.text: Having a regular study routine and following it is very important , right ?

64.speaker: speaker1
64.text: Good luck on your test tomorrow . We'll be crossing our fingers for you !

65.speaker: speaker1
65.text: I'll never ever work together with him !

65.speaker: speaker1
65.text: Will you take my materials back from him for me ? Please !

65.speaker: speaker2
65.text: Don't ask me . I don't wanna be involved in your quarrel .

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: Oh , my God ! I've been cheated !

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: It's a brick ! I can't believe how stupid I was . Damn it !

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: What is it ? Why did you buy a brick ?

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: There was a guy on the sidewalk.He had three new boxes , Panasonic video camera boxes.He said he had to get rid of them quick .

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: So he said he'd sell me one for twenty dollars . A four-hundred-dollar camera for twenty bucks .

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: I can't believe how stupid you are . Why didn't you open the box ?

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: I wanted to . But he said , no , the box is still in its plastic wrap from the store.If it's opened , other people won't believe it's new .

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: So he had the boxes wrapped in plastic .

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: Yes , it was the kind of perfect plastic wrap that comes with new products.Look , it even had a bar-code price sticker on it ! It looked brand new .

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: But why would a guy be selling new video cameras for twenty dollars ?

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: He said he had to get rid of them . They were stolen .

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: Aha ! Now I understand.You were trying to buy stolen goods on the sidewalk.So , what I think is , you deserve to get cheated !

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: C'mon , don't blame me ! I thought it was a new camera . We could use it.We were even thinking about buying a camera . I don't understand how he could have such a perfect-looking box .

66.speaker: speaker2
66.text: That's no problem.He just has a friend who works in a shop that can do plastic wrap . That's easy.And probably it's the same shop he got the boxes from.Maybe his friend works in an electronics store . They sell video cameras there.Probably they had a couple video camera boxes lying around.So they get the idea of wrapping bricks to sell to fools like you.Twenty dollars a brick . That's a good profit if they can sell enough bricks .

66.speaker: speaker1
66.text: You're right , Sarah . I was a fool . I can't believe it . How could I fall for such a trick ?

67.speaker: speaker2
67.text: I'm afraid it gains a little .

68.speaker: speaker2
68.text: Just so so . Last night I met this great guy at the bar and we had such a wonderful time , so we decided to meet again tonight .

68.speaker: speaker1
68.text: Oh , that's exciting . What does this guy look like ? Is he hot ?

68.speaker: speaker2
68.text: Well , I didn't think so at first . But as we started talking , I found him extremely funny and witty . I couldn't stop laughing at his jokes ! And we have so much in common . We like the same team , music , and most amazingly , we both love Chinese food ! I have the feeling that we are going to be great friends .

68.speaker: speaker1
68.text: It seems you two are a good match . What qualities do you look for in a friend ?

68.speaker: speaker2
68.text: There's nothing definite I think . I don't have a list or anything , but when I first meet somebody , I can usually tell whether or not that person is going to be a good friend . It seems I have radar helping me spot new friends .

68.speaker: speaker1
68.text: Well , that's something I've never heard of . But if you ask me what I value most in a friend , I would say honesty .

68.speaker: speaker2
68.text: I agree . You can't expect a close relationship with a dishonest person . Those are the people that will turn their back on you when you are in need .

68.speaker: speaker1
68.text: Yeah , I know . A friend in need is a friend indeed . I don't need fair-weather friends either .

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: What ’ s up ? You don ’ t look too good .

69.speaker: speaker2
69.text: Yeah , my head hurts , that ’ s all . I ’ Ve been in physics class all day . It ’ s killer !

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: I liked physics . It ’ s all math , really . arcs , curves , velocity , cool stuff .

69.speaker: speaker2
69.text: Yeah , yeah , but today ’ s lesson was all about the creation of the universe .

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: A physics class about the creation of the universe ? That ’ s some pretty unscientific language there . Sounds more religious to me .

69.speaker: speaker2
69.text: It ’ s all religion . Take the theory of the Big Bang.How is it possible that all of the stuff in the universe comes from an explosion ? That ’ s no better than Atlas carrying the globe on his back or African myths about turtles and stuff .

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: Turtles ? Whatever ... Look , all that ’ s required for the creation of matter an imbalance of particles and anti-particles . At least , that ’ s what the math says .

69.speaker: speaker2
69.text: Math , sheath . What ’ s the evidence ?

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: There is evidence ! You know Edwin Hubble ? He ’ s the guy who in the early twentieth century was the first scientist to measure the drift of matter in the universe , thus advancing notions of an expanding universe . What would it be expanding from ? Well , the Big Bang ... DUH !

69.speaker: speaker2
69.text: Anyway , it ’ s just a theory . Why do people go around touting theories ? Where ’ s the scientific rigor in that ?

69.speaker: speaker1
69.text: Dude , don ’ t equivocate . A theory only becomes a theory after withstanding rigorous testing . You slept through class , didn ’ t you ?

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: Today more and more people advocate lifelong learning . But people have different views about lifelong learning . How do you understand lifelong learning ?

70.speaker: speaker2
70.text: I think lifelong learning is the concept that it's never too soon or too late for learning

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: Does that mean studying all the time ?

70.speaker: speaker2
70.text: I don't think so . I think it's about your attitude towards learning . One should be open to new ideas , decisions , skills or behaviors .

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: Then the axiom - ' You can't teach an old dog new tricks ' doesn't work any longer .

70.speaker: speaker2
70.text: You're right . Lifelong learning is about finding learning opportunities at all ages and in numerous contexts

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: Yes , I agree with you . When I retired I will participate in programs to keep momentally active .

70.speaker: speaker2
70.text: Me too . To keep up with the changing world , one must be involved in lifelong learning and be ready to accept new things .

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: You know what ? I've recently been teaching myself French .

70.speaker: speaker2
70.text: Really ? That's great ! I know that your company has a lot of clients in France .

70.speaker: speaker1
70.text: Yes , so I want to learn French to develop my career .

71.speaker: speaker2
71.text: Nine ... but I'll be ten on May 1st.When is your birthday ?

71.speaker: speaker1
71.text: I'm older than you ! I'll be ten on April 14th .

71.speaker: speaker2
71.text: Are you going to have a birthday party ?

71.speaker: speaker1
71.text: Maybe . I'll have to ask my mother .

72.speaker: speaker1
72.text: It smells like an ashtray in here !

72.speaker: speaker2
72.text: Hi honey ! What ’ s wrong ? Why do you have that look on your face ?

72.speaker: speaker1
72.text: What ’ s wrong ? I thought we agreed that you were gonna quit smoking .

72.speaker: speaker2
72.text: No ! I said I was going to cut down which is very different . You can ’ t just expect me to go cold turkey overnight !

72.speaker: speaker1
72.text: Look , there are other ways to quit . You can try the nicotine patch , or nicotine chewing gum . We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month and now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place . It ’ s not like you can just light up like before .

72.speaker: speaker2
72.text: I know , I know . I am trying but , I don ’ t have the willpower to just quit . I can ’ t fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch ! Please understand ?

74.speaker: speaker1
74.text: It seems that you get antsy when you hear I praise another guy .

74.speaker: speaker2
74.text: I get antsy not because you praise a guy , but because you may be taken for a ride by a guy like him .

74.speaker: speaker1
74.text: How come you think of him that way ?

74.speaker: speaker2
74.text: Because you seem to have lost your vigilance . You should be on the watch out .

74.speaker: speaker1
74.text: I have no reason to distrust him . He's never caused any harm .

74.speaker: speaker2
74.text: Isn't there anything that sounds fishy ?

74.speaker: speaker1
74.text: Nothing smells a rat . I told you that he's an all-right guy .

74.speaker: speaker2
74.text: All-right guy ? All right . Let's talk about something else instead .

75.speaker: speaker2
75.text: I think so . Maybe that ’ s why it ’ s cheap here .

76.speaker: speaker1
76.text: Have you signed up to join the company ’ s Christmas party ?

76.speaker: speaker2
76.text: Sure , I have . Will you join ?

76.speaker: speaker1
76.text: I will . You know , as a newcomer , I think it might be a good opportunity to get to know people from the other departments of our company in a more relaxed atmosphere .

76.speaker: speaker2
76.text: You are right . Our company ’ s Christmas party has always been an amazing occasion for everybody to relax and get to know each other better . It is also a time to make new friends and do some networking .

76.speaker: speaker1
76.text: I hope that it is not a formal one when the boss is there .

76.speaker: speaker2
76.text: No , it will not be formal at all . It is a fun time . You will love the game show . Please dress casually . Usually there is an over abandon of drinks , so be careful with that .

76.speaker: speaker1
76.text: Don ’ t worry , I can handle that . And I know if the boss is there , even it is an informal evening , it does not make a good impression to get totally drunk in front of him .

77.speaker: speaker1
77.text: If the weatherman's predictions are accurate , it should rain tomorrow .

77.speaker: speaker2
77.text: I hope not . Then we'd have to reschedule our baseball game .

78.speaker: speaker1
78.text: hi , Emily , do you know that guy over there ?

78.speaker: speaker2
78.text: The tall one ? Sure , that's Drive , he works with Lily .

78.speaker: speaker1
78.text: He is cute.What dose he do ?

78.speaker: speaker2
78.text: I'm not sure , he is a manager I think .

78.speaker: speaker1
78.text: Really ? Are you going to introduce us ?

78.speaker: speaker2
78.text: Well , he has already taken you know , that's his wife right there .

79.speaker: speaker1
79.text: You didn't ring me last night . You said you would .

79.speaker: speaker2
79.text: I'm sorry to have made you disappointed .

79.speaker: speaker1
79.text: That's all right . But why were you so rude to me at lunch .

79.speaker: speaker2
79.text: Was I ? Sorry , I didn ’ t mean to be . I do apologize .

79.speaker: speaker1
79.text: And why are you yarning now ? Are you bored ?

79.speaker: speaker2
79.text: Forgive me darling . I'm very tired .

80.speaker: speaker1
80.text: Hi , Nicole . Did you have a good weekend ?

80.speaker: speaker2
80.text: Yes , I did . But I feel tired today .

80.speaker: speaker2
80.text: Well , on Saturday I cleaned the house and played tennis . Then on Sunday I hiked in the country .

80.speaker: speaker1
80.text: And I bet you studied , too .

80.speaker: speaker2
80.text: Yeah . I studied on Sunday evening . What about you ?

80.speaker: speaker1
80.text: Well , I didn't clean the house and I didn't study . I stayed in bed and watched TV .

80.speaker: speaker2
80.text: That sounds like fun , but did you exercise ?

80.speaker: speaker1
80.text: Sort of . I played golf on my computer !

81.speaker: speaker1
81.text: There will be a parade to celebrate National Day this weekend .

81.speaker: speaker1
81.text: From Zhongshan Circus to City Bank .

81.speaker: speaker2
81.text: If only I could join it !

82.speaker: speaker1
82.text: Excuse me . I'm afraid you're in my seat . You've moved my books .

82.speaker: speaker1
82.text: You must have realized somebody was here .

82.speaker: speaker2
82.text: Oh , well , I looked around . There wasn't any other space . I waited a while and nobody came . I'm sorry if I've taken your place .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: What ’ s the life expectancy in your country ?

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: I ’ m not sure , but probably about 75 years . How about in your country ?

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: About 70 , I think . This newspaper article talks about the problems of an aging population . It ’ s a problem that will soon affect most of the world .

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: I heard that the government might need to increase the retirement age , because otherwise there will not be enough workers to support the young and the elderly .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: Perhaps we need to have more babies ! Tina gave birth to a baby boy yesterday .

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: Did she ? That ’ s great . However , if we have too many children , that will have a bad effect on the enviroment .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: How ’ s your son these days ?

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: Oh , he ’ s fine . Kids seem to grow up very quickly nowadays .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: He ’ ll be a teenager before you know it ! Teenagers are often rebellious ! When do you mine it is a good age to have a child ?

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: I had mine when I was 24 . that ’ s a little young . I ’ d suggest you wait until you are in your late twenties . , or even in your early thirties if you have a good career .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: Yes , I think you ’ re right . I ’ m thinking about having a child , but not just yet .

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: Is there a big generation gap between parents and their children in you country ?

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: Yes , there is . Teenagers do not want to live traditional lives . They want to go out , have fun , and explore the world . They want to develop their own view of life . Parents usually try to discourage them , but they don ’ t often succeed .

83.speaker: speaker2
83.text: Parents usually give their children more freedom in my country . Sometimes they give them too much freedom .

83.speaker: speaker1
83.text: It ’ s almost impossible to get the right balance . If you are too strict , kids might ignore you . If you are too lenient , they might go wild .

84.speaker: speaker1
84.text: I'm going to Japan this year on vacation .

84.speaker: speaker2
84.text: Have you ever been to America ?

84.speaker: speaker1
84.text: No , but I'd really like to .

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: Hey , Mark , long time no see .

85.speaker: speaker2
85.text: Julie ! It's good to see you again . How have you been ?

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: Great . I just got back from a week's vacation in Thailand .

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: Fantastic ! I didn't want to come back .

85.speaker: speaker2
85.text: I hear the beaches in Thailand are beautiful .

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: They are . And not only that the people are friendly , but also the food is delicious , not to mention cheap .

85.speaker: speaker2
85.text: I do like Thai food . Did you see much of Bangkok ?

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: Not much . I've got enough city life in Beijing .

85.speaker: speaker2
85.text: I know what you mean . I could use a vacation myself .

85.speaker: speaker1
85.text: Hey , wouldn't it be great if we could go to Thailand together sometime ?

86.speaker: speaker1
86.text: Could I see the manager please ? I have a complaint to make .

86.speaker: speaker2
86.text: Yes , I ’ m the manager here . What can I do for you , Madam ?

86.speaker: speaker1
86.text: Did you have the room checked before we move in ?

86.speaker: speaker1
86.text: 1808 . The toilet doesn ’ t work properly , the water doesn ’ t run in the shower .

86.speaker: speaker2
86.text: I ’ m awfully sorry to hear that . I ’ ll turn to it right away .

87.speaker: speaker1
87.text: Congratulations , Vivian . You won the grand prize , again .

87.speaker: speaker2
87.text: Isn't it just great ! I just knew I'd win !

87.speaker: speaker1
87.text: You did ? How ? Did you wear red underwear again this year ?

87.speaker: speaker1
87.text: Tell me ! Tell me ! What's your secret ? !

87.speaker: speaker2
87.text: OK , OK . I'll whisper it to you , but you have to promise not to tell anyone !

88.speaker: speaker1
88.text: We are going to the concert this evening . Will you join us .

88.speaker: speaker2
88.text: I've been snowed under with since my bosses away on business .

89.speaker: speaker1
89.text: You'v been work here for nearly a month , how do you feel about the job ?

89.speaker: speaker2
89.text: Not bad.Thank you for your help . I am always busy with this job , I feel a bit tired .

89.speaker: speaker1
89.text: I had the same feeling when I first came to work here . but after a period of time , I feel better , I am sure you ' ll get used to this busy job .

89.speaker: speaker2
89.text: I also feel that work efficiency here is very high . and you have strong working ability and professional skill , it seems that you know all , that's really wonderful !

89.speaker: speaker1
89.text: You know the phrase , the survival the fittest . We have no choices .

89.speaker: speaker2
89.text: That's right , I have to work hard .

90.speaker: speaker1
90.text: The music is on.May I have the pleasure to dance with you ?

90.speaker: speaker2
90.text: Sorry , I'm engaged for the foxtrot.Will the next Walls be all right ?

91.speaker: speaker1
91.text: Excuse me , is this seat taken ?

91.speaker: speaker1
91.text: Yes I do . How about you ?

91.speaker: speaker2
91.text: No , I'm a tourist . This place is amazing ! It's much bigger than I imagined , and much more exciting ! There's so much to see here .

91.speaker: speaker1
91.text: You can say that again ! It's much more modern than people imagine . Where are you from ?

91.speaker: speaker2
91.text: Um , well let's see ... I'm from Kansas originally . A much quieter and more peaceful place than here , that's for sure !

92.speaker: speaker1
92.text: Look at this headline , Soo Mi .

92.speaker: speaker2
92.text: Wow ! So many people in the United States get divorced !

92.speaker: speaker1
92.text: Is it the same in Korea ?

92.speaker: speaker2
92.text: I don't think so . In Korea some marriages break up , but most couples stay together .

92.speaker: speaker2
92.text: Not really . Very few people get married beforethe age of 20 .

92.speaker: speaker1
92.text: Hmm . Do women usually work after they get married ?

92.speaker: speaker2
92.text: No , a lot of women stay home and take care of their families . But some work .

93.speaker: speaker1
93.text: Boy ! What a beauty ! I fall in love with her at the first sight .

93.speaker: speaker1
93.text: Of course.No girl is more charming .

94.speaker: speaker2
94.text: Oh , over there in Pacific Pavilion .

94.speaker: speaker1
94.text: Is that the large , white building ?

95.speaker: speaker1
95.text: How was your education going on in Australia ?

95.speaker: speaker2
95.text: I'm going to graduate this summer .

95.speaker: speaker1
95.text: Where are you going to work then , in Australia or back in China ?

95.speaker: speaker2
95.text: I'm planning to return to China after graduation .

95.speaker: speaker1
95.text: Why are you choosing to leave a foreign country ? Many people are reluctant to leave the superior living environment abroad .

95.speaker: speaker2
95.text: Well , I think personal development is much more important than simply having a superior living environment .

95.speaker: speaker1
95.text: Yeah , China's developing so fast and development opportunities can be found almost in every corner of the country .

96.speaker: speaker1
96.text: Do you have any particular hobbies , Tom ?

96.speaker: speaker2
96.text: Oh , yes . I love playing badminton , table tennis and computer games . And playing the games has become my favorite .

96.speaker: speaker1
96.text: I hear many teenagers will spend hours and hours sitting at computers . And they don't care about their own health at all . How about you ?

96.speaker: speaker2
96.text: I'm no better than them . They say it's mindless to sit in front of a machine all the time , but I think it's stimulating .

96.speaker: speaker1
96.text: You won't play online games full of violence , will you ?

96.speaker: speaker1
96.text: It's no good . And I think spending several hours each day playing computer games is a waste of time . You might as well do something healthy and meaningful .

96.speaker: speaker2
96.text: I hope I can practice self-control again .

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: What ’ s the plot of your new movie ?

97.speaker: speaker2
97.text: It ’ s a story about a policemen who is investigating a series of strange murders . I play the part of the detective . He has to catch the killer , but there ’ s very little evidence . It ’ s a psychological th

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: Did you enjoy making the movie ? We heard stories of disagreement with other actors and with the director .

97.speaker: speaker2
97.text: I have had disagreement with every director . I ’ Ve worked with . We ’ Ve always disagreed in a friendly way and we have always resolved our differences . It was the same when I made this movie . I don ’ t no

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: Critics are not very happy with the movies that you ’ Ve made recently . Does that bother you ?

97.speaker: speaker2
97.text: Not at all . The feedback from audience has been great . I care about what they think more than what the critics think .

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: Did you do you own stunts in the movie ?

97.speaker: speaker2
97.text: I wanted to , but my insurance company wouldn ’ t let me . All of my stunts were done by a stuntman . As you know , I used to do my own stunts , but I ’ ll leave that to the experts in future .

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: Thank you very much for doing this interview .

97.speaker: speaker2
97.text: My pleasure . Have you seen the movie yet ?

97.speaker: speaker1
97.text: Yes . I have . I liked it very much . Like you , I was very impressed with Rachel ’ s performance in the movie . She ’ s going to be a star .

98.speaker: speaker1
98.text: Who's that old lady trimming the trees ?

98.speaker: speaker1
98.text: She's looks very healthy.How old is she ?

99.speaker: speaker1
99.text: Mom . My legs are killing me .

99.speaker: speaker2
99.text: Hold on . We will be successful right away .
